While live actors could have portrayed the characters in a way that was emotionally effective, there are certain creative advantages to using animation that cannot be replicated in live-action movies. 

For instance, the animation style used in Anomalisa helped to create a unique visual style and allowed the filmmakers to execute a distinct creative vision. The animated characters and sets allowed for precise control over the look and feel of each scene, which would have been harder to achieve with live actors. Additionally, the exaggerated and slightly unreal animation style helped to achieve a surreal and dreamlike aesthetic which fit well with the film's themes of detachment and alienation. 

Moreover, animation isn't solely for children's entertainment, as shown by critically acclaimed animated films like Persepolis and Grave of the Fireflies. Anomalisa is an adult-oriented film that deals with themes of loneliness, alienation, and the search for human connection, all of which are explored in a mature and nuanced way. The use of animation in this film allowed for a unique and intimate exploration of the main character's emotional experience in a way that live-action may not have been able to achieve. 

Overall, while live-action movies can be emotionally effective, animation allows for certain creative freedoms that can offer a unique perspective and add depth to a film's message.
